snippet: The glowing assessments of the plant where more than 100 people were killed in a fiery explosion suggested government officials had missed problems.
abstract: Praise bestowed by Communist party officials upon Jilin Baoyuanfeng Poultry Plant in China before fire killed 120 people there serves as stark reminder that government often ignores dangerous conditions faced by workers; disaster highlights way in which government regulation is weakened by system that values economic growth above all else.

byline.contributor: Mia Li and Sue-Lin Wong contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The glowing assessments of the plant where more than 100 people were killed in a fiery explosion suggested government officials had missed problems.

headline.seo: Chinese Poultry Factory Was Considered a Model
headline.main: Poultry Plant in Deadly Fire Won Plaudits From Chinese
headline.print_headline: Poultry Plant In Deadly Fire Won Plaudits From Chinese
